post.description: Schedules a new run based on the request parameters and add it to the run queue.

parameters.name: runRequest
parameters.description: The parameters of a run that needs to scheduled.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

202.description: The request was successfully accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry/run doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned. If any of the input parameters is wrong, 400(Bad Request) is returned.

post.description: Get the upload location for the user to be able to upload the source.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned.

get.description: Gets all the runs for a registry.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The runs filter to apply on the operation. Arithmetic operators are not supported. The allowed string function is 'contains'. All logical operators except 'Not', 'Has', 'All' are allowed.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: $top is supported for get list of runs, which limits the maximum number of runs to return.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the detailed information for a given run.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry/run doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

201.description: The request was successfully accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously. The provisioning state of the resource should indicate the current state of the resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry/build doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned. If any of the input parameters is wrong, 400(Bad Request) is returned.

post.description: Gets a link to download the run logs.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry/run doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the properties of a specified task.

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

201.description: The request was successfully accepted; the operation will complete asynchronously. The provisioning state of the resource should indicate the current state of the resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed. If the registry doesn't exist, 404 (Not found) is returned. If any of the input parameters is wrong, 400(Bad Request) is returned.

parameters.name: taskUpdateParameters

RunRequest.description: The request parameters for scheduling a run.

type.description: The type of the run request.

isArchiveEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether archiving is enabled for the run or not.

digest.description: The sha256-based digest of the image manifest.

ImageUpdateTrigger.description: The image update trigger that caused a build.

id.description: The unique ID of the trigger.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the image update happened.

images.description: The list of image updates that caused the build.

SourceTriggerDescriptor.description: The source trigger that caused a run.

id.description: The unique ID of the trigger.

eventType.description: The event type of the trigger.

commitId.description: The unique ID that identifies a commit.

pullRequestId.description: The unique ID that identifies pull request.

branchName.description: The branch name in the repository.

timerTriggerName.description: The timer trigger name that caused the run.

scheduleOccurrence.description: The occurrence that triggered the run.

PlatformProperties.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

os.description: The operating system type required for the run.

AgentProperties.description: The properties that determine the run agent configuration.

cpu.description: The CPU configuration in terms of number of cores required for the run.

createTime.description: The time the run was scheduled.

outputImages.description: The list of all images that were generated from the run. This is applicable if the run generates base image dependencies.

task.description: The task against which run was scheduled.

imageUpdateTrigger.description: The image update trigger that caused the run. This is applicable if the task has base image trigger configured.

sourceTrigger.description: The source trigger that caused the run.

timerTrigger.description: The timer trigger that caused the run.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run will happen.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

sourceRegistryAuth.description: The scope of the credentials that were used to login to the source registry during this run.

customRegistries.description: The list of custom registries that were logged in during this run.

runErrorMessage.description: The error message received from backend systems after the run is scheduled.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of a run.

runId.description: The unique identifier for the run.

status.description: The current status of the run.

lastUpdatedTime.description: The last updated time for the run.

isArchiveEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether archiving is enabled or not.

SourceUploadDefinition.description: The properties of a response to source upload request.

uploadUrl.description: The URL where the client can upload the source.

relativePath.description: The relative path to the source. This is used to submit the subsequent queue build request.

nextLink.description: The URI that can be used to request the next set of paged results.

RunFilter.description: Properties that are enabled for Odata querying on runs.

runId.description: The unique identifier for the run.

status.description: The current status of the run.

createTime.description: The create time for a run.

outputImageManifests.description:
The list of comma-separated image manifests that were generated from the run. This is applicable if the run is of
build type.

isArchiveEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether archiving is enabled or not.

taskName.description: The name of the task that the run corresponds to.

RunUpdateParameters.description: The set of run properties that can be updated.

isArchiveEnabled.description: The value that indicates whether archiving is enabled or not.

RunGetLogResult.description: The result of get log link operation.

logLink.description: The link to logs for a run on a azure container registry.

principalId.description: The principal id of user assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client id of user assigned identity.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

userAssignedIdentities.description:
The list of user identities associated with the resource. The user identity 
dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: 
'/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/
    providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

BaseImageDependency.description: Properties that describe a base image dependency.

type.description: The type of the base image dependency.

digest.description: The sha256-based digest of the image manifest.

TaskStepProperties.description: Base properties for any task step.

baseImageDependencies.description: List of base image dependencies for a step.

contextPath.description: The URL(absolute or relative) of the source context for the task step.

contextAccessToken.description: The token (git PAT or SAS token of storage account blob) associated with the context for a step.

TimerTrigger.description: The properties of a timer trigger.

schedule.description: The CRON expression for the task schedule

AuthInfo.description: The authorization properties for accessing the source code repository.

token.description: The access token used to access the source control provider.

refreshToken.description: The refresh token used to refresh the access token.

scope.description: The scope of the access token.

expiresIn.description: Time in seconds that the token remains valid

SourceProperties.description: The properties of the source code repository.

sourceControlType.description: The type of source control service.

repositoryUrl.description: The full URL to the source code repository

branch.description: The branch name of the source code.

sourceControlAuthProperties.description:
The authorization properties for accessing the source code repository and to set up
webhooks for notifications.

SourceTrigger.description: The properties of a source based trigger.

sourceRepository.description: The properties that describes the source(code) for the task.

sourceTriggerEvents.description: The source event corresponding to the trigger.

BaseImageTrigger.description: The trigger based on base image dependency.

baseImageTriggerType.description: The type of the auto trigger for base image dependency updates.

sourceTriggers.description: The collection of triggers based on source code repository.

baseImageTrigger.description: The trigger based on base image dependencies.

SourceRegistryCredentials.description: Describes the credential parameters for accessing the source registry.

loginMode.description:
The authentication mode which determines the source registry login scope. The credentials for the source registry
will be generated using the given scope. These credentials will be used to login to
the source registry during the run.

SecretObject.description: Describes the properties of a secret object value.

value.description:
The value of the secret. The format of this value will be determined
based on the type of the secret object. If the type is Opaque, the value will be
used as is without any modification.

type.description:
The type of the secret object which determines how the value of the secret object has to be
interpreted.

CustomRegistryCredentials.description: Describes the credentials that will be used to access a custom registry during a run.

userName.description: The username for logging into the custom registry.

password.description:
The password for logging into the custom registry. The password is a secret 
object that allows multiple ways of providing the value for it.

identity.description:
Indicates the managed identity assigned to the custom credential. If a user-assigned identity
this value is the Client ID. If a system-assigned identity, the value will be `system`. In
the case of a system-assigned identity, the Client ID will be determined by the runner. This
identity may be used to authenticate to key vault to retrieve credentials or it may be the only 
source of authentication used for accessing the registry.

Credentials.description: The parameters that describes a set of credentials that will be used when a run is invoked.

sourceRegistry.description: Describes the credential parameters for accessing the source registry.

customRegistries.description:
Describes the credential parameters for accessing other custom registries. The key
for the dictionary item will be the registry login server (myregistry.azurecr.io) and
the value of the item will be the registry credentials for accessing the registry.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the task.

platform.description: The platform properties against which the run has to happen.

agentConfiguration.description: The machine configuration of the run agent.

step.description: The properties of a task step.

trigger.description: The properties that describe all triggers for the task.

credentials.description: The properties that describes a set of credentials that will be used when this run is invoked.

Task.description:
The task that has the ARM resource and task properties. 
The task will have all information to schedule a run against it.

nextLink.description: The URI that can be used to request the next set of paged results.

os.description: The operating system type required for the run.

contextAccessToken.description: The token (git PAT or SAS token of storage account blob) associated with the context for a step.

schedule.description: The CRON expression for the task schedule

refreshToken.description: The refresh token used to refresh the access token.

scope.description: The scope of the access token.

expiresIn.description: Time in seconds that the token remains valid

imageNames.description: The fully qualified image names including the repository and tag.

isPushEnabled.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image built should be pushed to the registry or not.

noCache.description: The value of this property indicates whether the image cache is enabled or not.

dockerFilePath.description: The Docker file path relative to the source location.

target.description: The name of the target build stage for the docker build.
